algorithms.imageProcessing

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.imageProcessing.Image
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageExt, Rectification.RectifiedImage

    public class Image
extends java.lang.Object
    space conserving image data holder. NOTE, because of internal pixel indexing, the size of this image is limited to 46340 pixels in width and height.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int[] b
      array holding blue image values in range 0-255 and 4 values stored in one int.
      protected long[] bL
      64 bit version of b array

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Image(int theWidth, int theHeight)
      NOTE, because of internal pixel indexing, the size of this image is limited to 46340 pixels in width and height.

      package protected constructor for use in testing.

      int getRGB(int col, int row)
      get the combined rgb value at image location col, row
      int getRow(int internalIndex)
      get the image pixel row location from the pixel index
      protected int getRowNumber(int pixelIdx)
      given the pixel index which is a number representing (row * width) + col for an uncondensed array, return the internal array element index (for example the index for the r array holding the value for pixelIdx would be at r[elementIdx] which itself holds 4 values on a 32 bit system or 8 on a 64 bit system.
      int[] getRValues() 
      int getWidth() 
      protected void init() 
      void resetTo(Image copyThis)
      reset the contents of this image to the contents of copyThis, but only if the dimensions are the same.

      protected long set64BitValue(long rowValue, int setValue, int byteNumber)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()

      • getRowNumber

        protected int getRowNumber(int pixelIdx)
        given the pixel index which is a number representing (row * width) + col for an uncondensed array, return the internal array element index (for example the index for the r array holding the value for pixelIdx would be at r[elementIdx] which itself holds 4 values on a 32 bit system or 8 on a 64 bit system.
        Parameters:
        pixelIdx -
        Returns:

        row -
        Returns:
